title: Darkthrone - Soulside Journey 1991 [EAC-WV]
description:
DARKTHRONE - SOULSIDE JOURNEY (1991)

Soulside Journey is the debut album by Darkthrone.

It is notable as being their first and only death metal release before becoming an integral part of the Norwegian black metal scene.

Oddly enough, Fenriz went by the moniker "Hank Amarillo". Later pressings of the albums show all of the band&#039;s pseudonyms rather than their real names.

Darkthrone are unique among death metal because of the absence of palm muting in any of the riffs; all of the songs are made up of fast tremolo and open notes which are far more prevalent among black metal bands.

   1. "Cromlech"  4:11
   2. "Sunrise Over Locus Mortis"  3:31
   3. "Soulside Journey"  4:36
   4. "Accumulation Of Generalization"  3:17
   5. "Neptune Towers"  3:15
   6. "Sempiternal Sepulchrality"  3:32
   7. "Grave With A View"  3:27
   8. "Iconoclasm Sweeps Cappadocia"  4:00
   9. "Nor The Silent Whispers"  3:18
  10. "The Watchtower"  4:58
  11. "Eon"  3:39

Ripped by Exact Audio Copy and packed to ISO.WV file container. Drop .wv to foobar2000 and listen. Or rename to .iso and open with WinRAR or CD emulator program (Alcohol 120%, for example). ISO contains also scans of CD covers.


SWEDISH SCHOOL DEATH METAL
